links.*: The Review of English Studies (Vol. 1 No. 2)

wikitext.*:
'''Some Contributions to Middle-English Lexicography''' is the title of an essay by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. In Part I Tolkien discusses aspects of a variety of [[Middle English]] words and their Modern English meanings. Part II consists of a series of notes on the glossary to the Early English Text Society Edition of ''[[Wikipedia:Katherine Group|Hali Mei√∞had]]''.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=13130|articlename=Review of English Studies. April 1925|dated=|website=TB|accessed=14 December 2013}}</ref>

The essay was first published in [[The Review of English Studies (Vol. 1  No. 2)|''The Review of English Studies'', Vol. 1  No. 2]] (April 1925), and was reprinted in [[The Review of English Studies (Vol. 1)|''The Review of English Studies'', Vol. 1]] (1969).
